breweries.name: Big Ditch Brewing Company
breweries.details: Big Ditch Brewing Company is a start-up of a production craft beer microbrewery located in downtown Buffalo, NY that is dedicated to providing quality, delicious, innovative, and drinkable craft beers for the Buffalo area. Big Ditch has a penchant for nailing the formula of what makes a great beer (which is why they won New York State’s Best Craft Brewery award at TAP Festival in 2016.) Visit their website for more details.

breweries.name: 42 North Brewing Company
breweries.details: East Aurora has its own craft brewery campus. From the taproom, brewery and beer garden to the Airbnb brewery themed rooms available for an overnight stay, 42 North offers an experience like nowhere else in Western New York. The taproom of 42 North is adorned with bricks and wood from throughout the region, including the historic Richardson Olmsted Campus. The taproom allows guests to experience the fruits of our labors while looking over the brewery production floor. Whether you are a regular or a first-time visitor, you will feel at home. Hangout. Play. But, most importantly, raise a cheer with a friend, a neighbor, or a new acquaintance. It’s the community living room. Right here on the 42nd parallel.

breweries.name: Abandon Brewing Company
breweries.details: Located in an early 19th-century farmhouse, in the quiet village of Penn Yan, Abandon Brewing Co. crafts some of the finest brews in New York state. Locally sourced ingredients are well fermented to create innovative flavors. The entire processing of brews operates on geothermal energy, making it a sustainable one. They offer three beers on tap, which are available for consumption at their tasting room. Call ahead for hours. Our goal is to hand-craft high-quality craft beers for Penn Yan and the surrounding Finger Lakes areas.

breweries.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
breweries.details: Daily featured ales on tap, including our award winning 'Bear Naked Ale'. Our hand-crafted brews are brewed on site in a copper-clad brewery... you won't be disappointed! Steak, seafood, lunch, dinner, on transit rt, wheelchair access, motor-coaches welcome & outdoor dining. Brewery tours selected days or by appointment during off season.

breweries.name: Amber Lantern Brewery
breweries.details: Tasty craft beer and delicious pub food. They offer a rotating selection of all your favorites to keep you full and happy. From salads, wraps, and quesadillas to burgers, fries, homemade macaroni and cheese, and more, you can’t go wrong! Amber Lantern offers a welcoming atmosphere perfect for casual attire. Catch a game on TV or enjoy the outdoor patio during the warmer months.

breweries.name: Argyle Brewing Company LLC
breweries.details: We have two locations. 1 Main Street, Greenwich, NY houses our brewery and small tasting room with a large patio outside. 6 Broad Street, Cambridge, NY is located in the historic train station with plenty of seating inside and out.

breweries.name: Arrowood Farms
breweries.details: Arrowood Farms is a terroir-driven farm brewery and distillery that crafts unique beverages inspired by nature, tradition, and regional agriculture. With a newly opened restaurant onsite, Arrowood Farms beverage and food program are the ultimate invitation to experience the Hudson Valley. Accessible. Child, pet, and group friendly. Free wi-fi.

breweries.name: Aurora Brewing Company
breweries.details: We're a nanobrewery perched on a hilltop overlooking Cayuga Lake just south of the village of Aurora, NY. Started in 2015 by two friends who share a passion for finely crafted beers of the world. We're brewing small batches of curious styles with a focus on hoppy beers, fruited and non fruited sours, and the unusual concoction. Come visit us on a weekend and enjoy the lake and vineyard views from our tasting room and backyard and have some food from our kitchen. For more info on what we are brewing and what's available on tap visit brewaurora.com ****COVID NOTICE**** Offering cans and bottles to go!

breweries.name: Ausable Brewing Company
breweries.details: Years of brewing experience, a farm to table focus, and live music makes this a destination for every craft brew enthusiast. Food truck available when open.

breweries.name: Bacchus
breweries.details: Bacchus is a restaurant and brewery in New Paltz, NY with hearty food, tasty beer & wine, a billiards room, live music, and a warm, neighborly atmosphere.

breweries.name: Battle Street Brewery
breweries.details: In 1870, the Dansville and Mount Morris Railroad began operation, a 15-mile standard-gauge short-line that ran independently until it was sold in 1985. Since then, the Dansville Mt. Morris depot has remained unused, a priceless historical building, and a repository of local history and tradition. Long in need of restoration, the depot has re-emerged as the Battle Street Brewery. It is a place that renews the glories of the past and kindles new friendships. It will truly embody the spirit of Dansville and Livingston County.

breweries.name: Becker Farms & Vizcarra Vineyards
breweries.details: For 5 Generations Becker Farms & Vizcarra Vineyards has continued to re-imagine what it means to be a small family farm. With agriculture at its heart, Becker Farms has created a host of products and services that have made it a staple of Western New York. From products like handmade pies, cookies, wine, beer and hard cider all grown and produced on the farm, to weddings and events, not to mention U-pick fruits and veggies, and with the addition of lodging this truly showcases Becker Farms as an agri-tourism destination. Becker Farms continues to hold strong the age-old tradition of providing fresh high-quality products from the farm directly to you. Open year-round.

breweries.name: Big Inlet Brewing
breweries.details: Big Inlet Brewing produces small batch, handcrafted beers designed and brewed on site.

breweries.name: Big Slide Brewery & Public House
breweries.details: This hybrid 3.5/5 barrel brewery is located right in the middle of the bar and dining area (safely behind glass, of course).

breweries.name: Black Forest Brew Haus
breweries.details: Our European trained Brewmasters use 200 year old German recipes to produce award winning beer for our best customers...you!

breweries.name: Blue Collar Brewery
breweries.details: Enjoy a rotating selection of craft ales and lagers with a meal at Blue Collar Brewery, housed in a re-purposed 19th century meat packing building in Poughkeepsie.

breweries.name: Blue Line Brewery Pizza & Pub
breweries.details: Nestled in the `All American City` in the heart of the Adirondacks you'll find the Blue Line Brewery.

breweries.name: Bolton Landing Brewing Company
breweries.details: Nestled in the 'All American City' in the heart of the Adirondacks you'll find the Blue Line Brewery.

breweries.name: Boots Brewing Company
breweries.details: Boots Brewing Company is a small-scale craft brewery and tap room.

breweries.name: Brewery of Broken Dreams
breweries.details: Stop by to check out The Brewery of Broken Dreams and taste the nine delicious brews currently on tap, including Crying Loon, Old Antics, Floating Leaf, and Unfinished Business, plus their rotating seasonal ales.

breweries.name: Brick House Brewery & Restaurant
breweries.details: Where else on Long Island can you find great food, fun people, live music, original art, and award-winning beer brewed right on the premises?

breweries.name: Brickyard Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Tin ceilings, rough-hewn hemlock walls and beetle kill pine behind the first-floor bar set off the ambiance. Six brewery standards, as well as rotating seasonal beers and lots of small batches from a Sabco Brew Magic pilot system in the brewhouse will be available.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.details: The Brooklyn Brewery in Williamsburg is responsible for the popular Brooklyn Lager and other iconic brews that you’ll see in bars throughout New York City and beyond.

breweries.name: Brown's Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Since 1993 our brewery has brought delicious handcrafted ales and lagers to upstate New York. Pint-by-pint, our distinctive beer has brought people together.

breweries.name: Adirondack Craft Beverage Trail
breweries.details: Sample varieties of craft beverages on the Adirondack Craft Beverage Trail. The Adirondack Beverage Trail is a self-guided tour of 27 beer, wine, cider, soda, and distilled spirits makers throughout Warren, Essex, Washington, and Northern Saratoga Counties. Each of these enterprises produce fine New York State products with dedication and pride

breweries.name: Brewery Ommegang
breweries.details: Brewery Ommegang opened in 1997 to craft-brew fine Belgian-style ales. Ommegang brews eight ales year-round, as well as an extensive and imaginative range of seasonal and specialty ales. Their brews have won a national following by beer connoisseurs and are distributed in 43 states and internationally. Ommegang is located on a 136-acre farmstead in Cooperstown, NY that offers free daily tours and inexpensive tastings as well as a well-stocked brewery store and an annual calendar of public events. The 100-seat Cafe Ommegang offers a menu featuring Belgian-inspired delights and many locally grown ingredients. Ommegang is open every day of the year except for Thanksgiving, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.

breweries.name: Buffalo RiverWorks
breweries.details: Buffalo RiverWorks might best be known as the place with the massive grain elevators painted to resemble a six-pack of beer visible from cruising altitude. But RiverWorks, in a relatively short period of time, has become much, much more . One of Buffalo’s remarkable examples of adaptive reuse, RiverWorks is constructed in the footprint and ruins of the former GLF grain silos, a reminder of Buffalo’s strong industrial heritage. This brewery, restaurant, sports, leisure, adventure and entertainment complex has become a one-of-a-kind destination along Buffalo’s waterfront. The question isn’t what can you do at Buffalo RiverWorks, it’s what CAN’T you do. If you’re scoping out a breezy place to relax along the Buffalo River, the RiverWorks brewery and beer garden are calling your name. Looking to get on the water? Rent a kayak, stand up paddleboard and hop on the Buffalo CycleBoat or Buffalo Tiki Tour. This brewery, restaurant, sports, leisure, adventure and entertainment complex has become a one-of-a-kind destination along Buffalo’s waterfront featuring fun throughout summer and winter including ziplining, rock climbing, roller derby, ice skating, curling and more!

breweries.name: Cooperstown Brewing Company
breweries.details: Nestled in Upstate and just outside of Cooperstown, Cooperstown Brewing Company was founded in 1995. We combine baseball and brewing so that you can celebrate America's past time in the right way.

breweries.name: Ellicottville Brewing Company
breweries.details: Savor the aromas and flavors of the specialty brews at Ellicottville Brewing Company along with their unique American Grill menu. Beers are brewed in small batches using the finest and freshest raw materials. They've been recognized as one of the best breweries and bars in New York State and have received multiple International World Beer Championship awards.

breweries.name: Indian Ladder Farms
breweries.details: Spend a day at the farm! Nature, fresh foods and the farm experience. Enjoy our seasonal pick-your-own strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, apples, local foods, unique gifts. Homemade pies & baked goods; Yellow Rock Café; Friendly farm animals, nature trails (Helderberg Escarpment); field trips and farm parties. Indian Ladder Farms Cidery & Brewery produces hard cider and beer using crops such as apples, pears, berries and pumpkins as well as hops and malting barley grown on Indian Ladder and other local farms. Tasting room is open to the public for beer and hard cider by the glass as well as growler-fills, crowlers, and 4-packs. A TasteNY attraction.

breweries.name: New York Kitchen
breweries.details: New York Kitchen, formerly the New York Wine & Culinary Center, is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with a mission to educate, engage, and excite visitors in a celebration of the incredible agricultural, craft beverage, and culinary bounty of New York State. Each day, New York Kitchen drives their mission forward through educational hands-on cooking and craft beverage pairing classes, industry certification courses, and the 100% New York State Tasting Room. Through partnerships with area farmers, wineries, breweries, distilleries, producers, and entrepreneurs, New York Kitchen offers an array of inviting experiences which proudly highlight and promote the quality, diversity, and economic impact of food and beverages that originate in New York State. Operating year-round, public/private programming and special events are offered.

breweries.name: Saranac Brewery
breweries.details: An official Path Through History Site! Tour the FX Matt Brewing company where Saranac beers and soft drinks are created. Learn the history of this legacy brewery (FX Matt Brewery was the first brewery in the nation to sell a beer at the end of Prohibition in 1933!) and the Matt family's German heritage. Stop in the 1888 Tavern after the tour or anytime as they are open to the public for sampling or purchase. Brewery tours are offered on Fridays and Saturdays.

breweries.name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
breweries.details: Southern Tier Brewing Company is committed to providing delicious, accessible, and unique products. In doing so, they aim to change the way people drink beer. Their mission is to provide customers with consistently fresh, clean, American craft ales and lagers that stand on their own merit. Brewery tours are available on Saturdays.

breweries.name: 12 Gates Brewing Company
breweries.details: 12 Gates Brewing Company will be serving up the finest, most unique, micro brewed beers in western New York.

breweries.name: Buried Acorn Brewing
breweries.details: Buried Acorn specializes in Barrel-Aged Sour and Farmhouse Beer, but don't worry hop heads, you will get some love too. Our primary focus at Buried Acorn will lie on the wild side of the spectrum. Funk Wrangler Timothy Lucien Shore has spent over a decade studying the world of mixed-fermentation Wild Ales through both industry experience and years of home brewing. Our taproom features 16 draft lines pouring Barrel-Aged mixed-fermentation sour Ales, classic and long-forgotten Farmhouse styles, as well as some monogamous hopped up offerings.

breweries.name: Butternuts Beer & Ale
breweries.details: Nestled in the beautiful Butternut Valley on a 120-acre dairy farm in Garrattsville, Butternuts prides itself on creating no-nonsense beers made with simple, natural ingredients that combine American-style farmhouse ales with German, English and Belgian influences. Stop by to sample their year-round brews and specialty brews on tap, take a brewery tour, and pick up a six pack or growler to bring home with you. Open 12 pm to 5 pm daily.

breweries.name: Captain Lawrence Brewing Co. Barrel House
breweries.details: Captain Lawrence Barrel House is the newest venture from Scott Vaccaro and his team. Located in Mount Kisco, the Barrel House combines all of your favorite elements of hanging out at the brewery in Elmsford while in a sleek, industrial setting. With our freshly brewed beer and our new food truck serving brewery favorites, this new spot is an experience you don’t want to miss.

breweries.name: Catskill Brewery
breweries.details: A world-class production craft brewery using state of the art green technology for an honest, hardworking beer made by hand from Catskill mountain water and all natural ingredients. The Catskill Brewery is a state of the art, sustainable craft brewery.

breweries.name: Chatham Brewing
breweries.details: Brewed fresh, brewed local, Chatham Brewing’s award-winning selection of beers are made with the finest hops and malts available. 14 varieties of lively and unique ales and lagers are on tap at our tasting room with new seasonal offerings. Have a pint of your favorite while enjoying farm-fresh fare from our food truck. Enjoy outdoor seating and live music on the weekends. We’ve got cans, growlers and kegs fresh from the brewery for your wedding, special event, or just because you’re thirsty. Stop by Wednesday-Monday for a true Main Street experience.

breweries.name: Clemson Brewing Company
breweries.details: We source only the finest quality hops, barley and malt and slow brew all of our beer. This, along with tapping them freshly made is the secret to our premium craft beers high quality flavor. Our kitchen turns out super delicious craft burgers made from 100% angus beef. We source our vegetables from local farms whenever possible.

breweries.name: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Company & Hop Farm
breweries.details: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Company is one of New York State’s first farm breweries. Specializing in small-batch, hand-crafted ales brewed on-site with the freshest estate-grown hops and barley harvested just a few miles down the road. Their award-winning IPA is always on tap.

breweries.name: Coney Island Brewing Company
breweries.details: Coney Island Brewing Company is a craft brewery that makes world-class Coney Island brand favorites with labels featuring Coney icons, such as Mermaid Pilsner and Overpass IPA. At their Surf Avenue brewery, visitors can take free brewery tours and stop in for tastings seven days a week. There is also a retail store on site where they sell growlers of their draft beer, as well as logoed merchandise. This Brooklyn-based company celebrates the local community while exposing more people to the thrills unique to its brand and its landmarked location.

breweries.name: Cooper's Cave Ale Company
breweries.details: Cooper's Cave Ale Company adds the taste of the Adirondacks to every batch brewed. Beer selections include Sagamore (oatmeal) Stout, IPA (Irate Patty's Ale), and Bumpo's Brown Ale. Try a handcrafted gourmet soda like Gracie's Grape, Dracula's Blood (strawberry), wild cherry cream, traditional root beer, and more. Stop by the ice cream window for hard or soft serve cones or a dish and all the favorites including super sundaes, banana splits, milkshakes, and floats. All hard ice cream flavors are made on-site.

breweries.name: Council Rock Brewery
breweries.details: Council Rock Brewery in Cooperstown offers handcrafted brews and hearty food in an intimate setting. The brewery features a variety of ten house brews on tap all of which pair nicely with a menu highlighted by their weekly Friday fish fry 5pm - 10pm, first come, first served.

breweries.name: Crafty Ales and Lagers
breweries.details: Crafty Ales and Lagers invites you to stop by the brewery to “Put some magic in your mouth!” Housed in the oldest building in Phelps, Crafty Ales and Lagers is a nanobrewery with a selection of small batch craft beers and complex ales like Mystic Mild, Crafty Cream Ale and Crooked Wand, an East Coast-style pale ale. The brewery specializes in using local ingredients, with the hops in Mystic Mild coming from Cheshire and honey in the Crafty Cream Ale from Geneva. Owner and Head Brewmaster Mike Darling makes beers with local fruit and Finger Lakes maple syrup as well. Take a trip to the brewery’s tasting room for special seasonal brews as well as T-shirts, glasses and growler fills. On Wednesday nights, listen to live music.

breweries.name: Critz Farms Brewing & Cider Company
breweries.details: Visit the beautiful tasting room at Critz Farms to sample our farm brewed beers and handcrafted hard ciders made in small batches with ingredients grown on the farm. See our historic 1890’s four screw cider press and enjoy the farm scenery. We serve tastings, or glasses, and offer bottle sales, growler fills, light fare and snacks. Call to schedule group tours or private events. Open March to December with days and hours changing seasonally.

breweries.name: Crossroads Brewing Company
breweries.details: Located in the historic, riverside Village of Athens, Crossroads Brewing Company is located in the former Brooks Opera House, built in 1893. Since opening in 2010, Crossroads has taken home several prestigious awards for their quality driven brews including a World Beer Cup Gold Medal and a Silver and Bronze Medal at the Great American Beer Festival. They've twice received the Matthew Vassar Cup for Best Brewery in the Hudson Valley at TAP NY.You'll want to come hungry as the seasonally changing menu features fresh meats, cheeses and produce from local farms and artisans. Crossroads is proud to have been voted Best Restaurant in Greene County in 2014 and 2016. For the non-beer drinkers, Crossroads offers several wines, including a few from NYS, Nine Pin Cider from Albany and a handful of locally distilled liquors along with NYS sodas and our famous house-made Root Beer. Grab your pint and take a walk around the pub to check out the historic Athens photos and an up close view of the brewery. Crossroads may be off the beaten path but it's well worth the trip!

breweries.name: Crossroads Brewing Company
breweries.details: Our newest location in the heart of Catskill features a friendly taproom with a great view of our 20 bbl brewhouse. Relax with a pint of one of our award winning brews and grab a growler and souvenir while you’re here!

breweries.name: Davidson Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.details: Unique pub atmosphere in a completely restored bldg overlooking historic downtown. Only brew pub in NYS with an authentic brick kettle brew system imported from England. A family friendly restaurant. TasteNY attraction.

breweries.name: Druthers Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Druthers doesn’t just sell beer. We’re serious about rewarding those amongst us who live according to Simple Truths, go Against the Grain, throw themselves All-In, and trust Karma to pay tribute where and when it’s earned and due. Our beer is brewed as a tribute to those who put their life, work, and convictions to the test. We all make a life one choice at a time and we know that our loyal enthusiasts are trading up, spending more, and drinking better. We’ll never make concessions as an aberration against the spirit of our beer. Our commitment to choice beer will always be focused on quality, not gimmicks or hype. The kind of quality that makes Druthers the right choice. We’re living our choice. Given our Druthers, we’re choosing to brew.

breweries.name: Druthers Brewing Company
breweries.details: Druthers Brewing Company is nestled in the center of Broadway in Saratoga Springs. Both outdoor and indoor dining is offered along with friendly service, a casual atmosphere, a variety of food options, and, of course, Druthers Brewing Company's crafted beers.

breweries.name: Dublin Corners Farm Brewery
breweries.details: Dublin Corners Farm Brewery is a fifth-generation family farm located in the Western Finger Lakes Region of New York State. They are proud to be the first brewery operating in Livingston County and the first stop on the Livingston Libation Loop. They invite you to visit the farm for a country experience full of fresh craft brews made with hops grown right outside the door. The original farm nano brewery is still located in the Town of York, NY. Serving up fresh local brews Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays - featuring their very own home-grown hops and other NYS grown ingredients. They also have live music every weekend. In September 2019, they opened a branch location in Geneseo, NY. Visit the Tap Room located at 116 Main Street featuring their beers along with a rotating guest tap serving up other NYS beers and a rotating NY Cider tap.

breweries.name: Eastwood Brewing Company
breweries.details: This unique brewery is tucked away in the Eastwood section of Syracuse just of James St. Enjoy an excellent selection of brews ranging from IPA's to stouts to Belgian's to ales, a little something for everyone! Plenty of parking available and shopping and culinary opportunities within this plaza as well. Located close to the hotels in the East Syracuse-Carrier Circle area and only 10 minutes from Syracuse University.

breweries.name: Eli Fish Brewing Company
breweries.details: The first commercial brewery in Batavia in nearly 100 yrs. They offer a selection of house brews along with other New York State produced beers, spirits, and wines. A full dining menu, large brew hall, beautiful bar, indoor bocce, and a great place to make new friends. The seven-barrel brewhouse steam-powered system includes four fermenters and one Brite tank. There are 20 lines total. The rest is New York State-produced beers. With a brewpub license, they can sell everything you would find in a regular bar. Also home to the FreshLAB, the first restaurant incubator of its kind in the Finger Lakes Region which includes the micro-brewery and food creation stations that feature locally-sourced farm fresh ingredients served food-hall style. Customers who come into Eli Fish will have access to three different menus. Each of the kitchens will have concession windows. Eli Fish will offer a full bar, complete with craft cocktails, spirits, and ciders, most of which will come from New York state.

breweries.name: Finger Lakes Beer Company, LLC
breweries.details: The Finger Lakes Beer Company features a beer tasting room where visitors can sample four types of brews: a pale ale, a spiced ale, a Scotch ale, and a stout, all crafted on the premises. Wayne Peworchik and Mark Goodwin co-own The Finger Lakes Beer Company, which homemade root beer is served. The owners spent more than a year renovating their building from a former restaurant. A seven-barrel system is used to produce a 210-gallon batch of beer, or 14 half-kegs. Each batch takes nearly seven hours to brew and is conditioned to serve three weeks later. Brewery tours are offered of the brewing rooms. Ingredients such as hops and malt have been imported from places as far away as England, Canada, and the American West. However, Keuka Lake provides water, which is a key ingredient. Adventure Pairing There are a number of awesome outdoor adventures just waiting to be discovered in proximity to each of our beverage producers. Please find suggested adventure pairings and have fun crafting your adventure.Keuka Lake, Finger Lakes Trail

breweries.name: Mazza Chautauqua Cellars
breweries.details: Five & 20 Spirits shares its new Westfield, NY home with Mazza Chautauqua Cellars, offering premium New York Wines alongside our high-quality small-batch distilled products, with a brewing operation in 2014 with beer available late 2014 and early 2015. Five & 20 Spirits produces quality, small-batch products. Working with small batches allows for greater attention to detail, and it also allows us to be creative & flexible with our products so we can offer you exciting and unique beverages. And because of our grain-to-glass model, we will be able to provide you with a truly local taste in a growing industry. A distinctly unique 3-in-one site, Winery, Brewery & Distillery. Taste NY Attraction.

breweries.name: Flying Bison Brew Company
breweries.details: Flying Bison Brewing Company is a brewery located at Larkin Square, and the first stand alone brewery to operate in the city proper since Iroquois Brewing closed its doors in 1972. An award-winning brewer with over 20 years experience, owner Tim Herzog made a strong commitment from the inception of this company as merely an idea to establish Flying Bison Brewing Company in the City of Buffalo and foster the return of what was once a flourishing industry. It’s this commitment that has carried the way for the brewery to become what it is today. Please enjoy all Flying Bison beers responsibly.

breweries.name: Foothill Hops Farm Brewery and Brew Shop
breweries.details: Foothill Hops Farm Brewery is both preserving the past and shaping the future. Enjoy a flight or pint of craft ale while you view the many historical hops artifacts in the tasting room, chat with the brewer/owner, tour the hop yard and experience planting, harvest and processing, or visit the home brew shop for your home brewing and wine making needs.Small batch brewing means the beer is always fresh and made with 100% New York State ingredients. Fill a growler to go and purchase some of their unique hops cuisine including hop lemonade, beer and hops mustard, beer bread mix, beer glazed nuts, and hop seasoning for your own backyard brew fest.

breweries.name: Four Mile Brewing
breweries.details: Four Mile Brewing is a great stop for craft beer enthusiasts. Their home is a former brewery which was closed during Prohibition. They've updated the building and added a kitchen which serves deli-style sandwiches, salads and jumbo pretzels. Hours are Thursdays 4-10pm, Fridays and Saturdays noon -10pm, Sunday brunch 10am-2pm, then open 'til 8pm, and they're closed Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday. You will also find their beers on tap in many local restaurants and bars.

breweries.name: Fox N Hare
breweries.details: Fox N Hare is a small town brewery and restaurant meant to celebrate great beer, savory food and wonderful people. The taproom is a welcoming place for all walks of life, whether you are a fox, a hare, or someone that just likes the taste of good beer. They are a collective of people dedicated to providing highquality craft beer and farm-fresh food to the tri-state. The Fox N Hare is set in the historic River Town of Port Jervis, NY, which sits along the Delaware River. The historic downtown sits at the intersection of NY, NJ, and PA. The Fox N Hare intends to embrace the many talented farmers, bakers and artisans in the area.

breweries.name: Full Boar Craft Brewery & Tap Room
breweries.details: Full Boar Craft Brewery and Tap Room features great craft brews from all over NYS as well as their own brews specializing in ales, stouts and porters. Operating a 3 barrel system, Full Boar brews on premises and is open Wednesday thru Sunday. Check their website for hours.

breweries.name: Garland City Beer Works
breweries.details: Garland City Beer works opened its doors back in 2018 and have been striving to provide customers with consistent quality product ever since. They are committed to making Garland City a destination brewery. Daily specials. The vision and mission of Garland City Beer Works is to brew high quality and tasty craft beers, with the finest hops and yeasts for the people of Watertown, to the Thousand Islands region and beyond.

breweries.name: Gene McCarthy's
breweries.details: Nestled among grain elevators, multi-family homes and a network of railroad tracks in Buffalo's First Ward. McCarthy's is still a favorite of workers at the nearby mills, firefighters, police and politicians. In recent years, a fine selection of craft and regional beers have been featured on tap. In fact, Old First Ward Brewing Company is now brewing over 25 beers! Known for its beef on weck, corned beef and cabbage, and fish fry. *One of 14 locations on the Buffalo Wing Trail*

breweries.name: Genesee Brewing Company
breweries.details: The Genesee Brewing Company is based in Rochester, New York and is one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in the United States. High Falls is best known for its historic Genesee line of brands as well as its JW Dundee's Ales & Lagers family of craft brands which includes the Original Honey Brown Lager. Through its Allied Brands division, High Falls is also America's exclusive distributor of several imports including Steinlager from New Zealand, Toohey's New from Australia and Imperial from Costa Rica.

breweries.name: Glass Factory Bay Brewing
breweries.details: White Springs Winery in Geneva is now also home to the Glass Factory Brew House. The name is a tribute to the glass factory that existed from 1810 until 1844 on Glass Factory Bay, directly across from the Brew House. The Brew House offers beer and root beer tastings daily. Current beer styles include Pilsner, India Pale Ale and Doppelbock. All are crafted locally on Seneca Lake. Glass Factory also serves hard cider.

breweries.name: Glenmere Brewing Company
breweries.details: Glenmere Brewing Company is a locally owned and operated brewery. All brewing is done on premises in the 15 bbl brewhouse. Tap room is open to drink pints, taste a flight, fill growlers, and tour the 2000-square-foot facility. Live music every Saturday. A Taste NY attraction.

breweries.name: Good Nature Farm Brewery
breweries.details: Good Nature Brewing is a small, independently owned microbrewery & Tap Room located in Hamilton, NY. They are their county's first brewery in 200 years, and are New York State's first Farm Brewery. They handcraft all-natural ales brewed with local ingredients. They collaborate with local farmers, artists, & small businesses to celebrate all that the region and community have to offer. They offer growler fills, kegs, flights, beer and cider by the glass, merchandise, local food items and crafts out of the Tap Room in downtown Hamilton. You can also find their ales in bars and restaurants across Central New York. Special events and live music shows on a weekly basis out of the Tap Room.

breweries.name: Gordon Biersch Brewery
breweries.details: This newest Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant features an on-site brewery where diners can experience Gordon Biersch’s award-winning house beers along with limited-time brews to compliment all seasons. Each seasonal beer is celebrated with a tapping party that’s open to the public. Lager fans also will discover special beer produced only at the Buffalo location. But don’t forget the food! The Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant menu features a made-from-scratch American menu with bold international flavors. Diners can enjoy Blackened Ahi Tuna, Tuscan Chicken Pasta, Cedar Plank Pecan Crusted Salmon, and signature garlic fries, just to name a few. For non-beer drinkers, there is fresh-squeezed lemonade and house-made root beer, along with other drinks. The Bread Pudding is one of Gordon Biersch’s best-selling desserts.

breweries.name: Great Adirondack Brewing Company
breweries.details: Our seven barrel stainless steel brewhouse produces a wide range of ales and lagers year round, using the finest imported and domestic ingredients available. Also on premise is the Great Adirondack Steak and Seafood Restaurant.

breweries.name: Green Wolf Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Green Wolf Brewing Co. is a licensed Farm Brewery located in the Schoharie County hamlet of Middleburgh, NY. Our uncommon ales are crafted with love and attention to detail, using local ingredients whenever possible. We have a rotating selection of our ales, our sodas, and other Farm Brewery beer at our tap room. Come visit us, enjoy live music, enjoy a good drink, play a board game, and discover our beautiful county. Drink. Howl. Repeat!

breweries.name: Greenport Harbor Brewing Company
breweries.details: Two brewery locations: One on Carpenter Street (next to The Old Jail) in Greenport and the other in Peconic with a large beer garden and restaurant. Find their beer on tap, in bottles and cans across Long Island, in New York City, upstate New York, Conn & NJ. Beers have been featured in the Village Voice, Newsday, TimeOutNY, and the Wall Street Journal amongst others. Greenport Harbor Brewing Company's Restaurant at the main brewery in Peconic, New York. The food menu designed by acclaimed chef Vincent Purcell affirms our commitment to locally sourced ingredients from produce to protein and seafood - all grown, harvested, or raised on the North Fork. At the newly designed restaurant space in Peconic, New York they are offering up delicious menu items such as Long Island Duck Spring Rolls, House Cured Salmon Sammy, Fish & Chips battered with Tidal Lager, and the classic Brewer's Burger.

breweries.name: Grist Iron Brewing Company
breweries.details: Opened in 2015, Grist Iron Brewing Co. is an independently owned craft brewery based in Burdett, NY, overlooking Seneca Lake in the heart of the Finger Lakes region. We love craft beer and want to share that love with the world, so we produce a variety of beers from lagers to sours to IPAs to stouts so every person through our door can find something in the craft beer realm that they like to drink. We also believe that beer is best when paired with some bangin' food, so we offer a menu of fresh, seasonal pub-style chews to pair with our tap lineup, including house-smoked BBQ dishes, pizzas, and mac & cheese. Open year-round, we offer live music every weekend, special events throughout the year, amazing sunset views, and onsite beer-centric dog-friendly lodging

breweries.name: Hamburg Brewing Company
breweries.details: The Hamburg Brewing Company is dedicated to crafting great beers. We are determined to further enhance the history and ever-growing beer culture found in the Western New York area by letting our fresh, high quality products speak for themselves. Hamburg Brewing Company has the perfect tranquil setting to consume and enjoy wonderful beers.

breweries.name: Horseheads Brewing
breweries.details: TAP NY Winner - Best Craft Beer Brewery in New York State! Offering hand-crafted, high quality beer brewed with the freshest and highest quality ingredients, resulting in exceptionally clean, fresh, pure and delicious ale! Stop by our tasting room to sample a wide variety of regular and seasonal beers.

breweries.name: Hudson Ale Works
breweries.details: Small-batch craft brewery located in the hamlet of Highland. Just steps away from the majestic Hudson River, Walkway Over the Hudson, Hudson Valley Rail Trail. Hudson Ale Works is close to many New York State wineries. Serving rotating beers and local tavern snacks.

breweries.name: Hudson Brewing Company
breweries.details: Serving an original recipe beers made from NY State local hops and grains, wine and cider. Light fare. Outdoor beer garden with lawn games during the nicer weather.

breweries.name: Hudson Valley Brewery
breweries.details: The tasting room is open Thursday–Sunday. 32oz crowlers cans of select styles are available for purchase to take home. Glass growlers are not filled. Can releases are announced on social media channels and via the brewery's newsletter. The Barb's Butchery pop-up kitchen is open on Saturdays and Sundays. On Thursdays and Fridays, food is not served, but please feel free to bring in snacks or sandwiches from outside in. Park in the municipal parking lot on Churchill Street and enter through the back of the warehouse.

breweries.name: Hyde Park Brewing Company
breweries.details: Experience traditionally brewed ales and lagers with a modern twist at this Hyde Park brew pub and restaurant! Sample the crisp and refreshing Big Easy Blond or the robust Rough Rider Red Ale -- each beer compliments the wide variety of locally sourced menu items. Open for lunch and dinner, with live music on the weekends.

breweries.name: Iron Flamingo Brewery
breweries.details: Sure the name might come from a friendly prank, but the folks at Iron Flamingo Brewery are serious about crafting great brews. Iron Flamingo is the first craft brewery in Corning focused on producing beers to distribute to local restaurants and bars, as well as to larger retail outlets like Wegmans. To date, you can find their beers in nearly four-dozen locations throughout the region. Ben Maurer was already home brewing when his dad got the idea of starting a brewery. After learning more about the craft from a master brewer, Ben took over brewing at Iron Flamingo, while also helping in the tasting room and doing a little of everything else that's needed along with his mom and dad.

breweries.name: Ithaca Beer Company
breweries.details: Ithaca Beer Co., established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. From the friendly staff to the award-winning beer to extensive community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile. Take a moment to look around Ithaca Beer's brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers they brew, and their involvement in Ithaca, NY. And don't forget to check out the Ithaca Beer Taproom.

breweries.name: Keegan Ales
breweries.details: For all of you who want to see the process of how we make such a delicious brew, well you just may be in luck. We’ve decided to set some hours to give tours of the brewery to everyone for free. Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 1-6pm each day we will give tours of the brewery at the top of each hour. So stop by and let your bartender know that you would like a tour.

breweries.name: Keuka Brewing Company
breweries.details: As the first Finger Lakes microbrewery on Keuka Lake, it offers an alternate world-class epicurean experience for people who enjoy beer and Finger Lakes wine alike. Owners and operators Linda and Richard Musso have been brewing for years, and bring much expertise to Keuka Brewing. Using only premium ingredients of wheat, malted barley, and a variety of hops, a variety of top-grade hand-crafted ales and beers have been introduced to the Finger Lakes Region. These include White Cap Wazz-berry, Briglin Road Red, Hoppy Laker IPA, and Bluff Point Brown. Keuka Brewing tasting room offers a break from wine tasting, allowing visitors to sample a variety of premium ales. Filled growlers (64-oz glass containers) are available for sale. Keuka Brewing Company won the F. X. Matt Memorial Cup in 2014 at the TAP New York Craft Beer and Food Festival, declaring it the Best Craft Brewery in New York State! Adventure Pairing There are a number of awesome outdoor adventures just waiting to be discovered in proximity to each of our beverage producers. Please find suggested adventure pairings and have fun crafting your adventure. Keuka Lake, Finger Lakes Trail.

breweries.name: Lake George Brew House
breweries.details: The Lake George Brew House produces craft beer for brewing companies in New York State and elsewhere. We offer a draft selection of over 15 different beers brewed on premises. Our core brands are Northway Brewing Company and Cooperstown Brewing Company. We also produce cold brew coffee as well as craft sodas. We offer tours of our brewery production and tastings. When you visit don't leave without a few pints of your choice of selections or come in for a growler refill of your favorite beverage!

breweries.name: Lake Placid Pub and Brewery
breweries.details: Since 1996 we served great beers and delicious food in a comfortable atmosphere with the freshest microbrewed ales and lagers, including the famous Ubu Ale, and traditional pub fare sure to please everyone. Sample the award-winning ales and lagers produced right in the building with our seven-barrel brewing system. We always have six handcrafted beers on tap.

breweries.name: Livingood's Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.details: Established in 2005, Livingood’s Restaurant & Brewery is committed to fostering relationships with local agriculture to enable them to offer a wide variety of the freshest, house-made menu items. From their tasty menu to their delicious craft brews Livingood’s has something for everyone. Livingood’s Restaurant & Brewery also has a “Great Room” than can accommodate large groups for events and meetings.

breweries.name: Lock 32 Brewing Company/Seven Stories
breweries.details: Lock 32 Brewing Company's tasting room offers a scenic location on the canal to enjoy great local beer with friends. Along with signature Lock 32 beers, they also feature a steady rotation of three other outstanding brews from the local area. To help round out the menu, there is always a refreshing 1911 Hard Cider on tap as well as some non-alcoholic beverages for the kids and non-drinkers of the group.

breweries.name: Lunkenheimer Craft Brewing Company
breweries.details: Lunkenheimer Craft Brewing Co. is a small batch, hand-crafted brewing company located in the historic Erie Canal village of Weedsport, New York. We have the flexibility to experiment and offer an ever-changing variety of creative and unusual ales. We are the place where your pour is incredibly fresh, the glass is always half full and everyone celebrates by wetting their whistle. We are this town’s best doggone brew. Scheduled Hours of Operation:  Thurs & Fri: 3-9PM, Sat. 12-9PM, Sun. by chance.

breweries.name: Market Street Brewing Company & Restaurant
breweries.details: From wings to burgers to pasta, seafood and vegetarian entrees M.S.B.C.'s menu covers it all. Our Chef, a Johnson and Wales graduate, creates daily specials as well. All foods prepared right on premise.

breweries.name: Mean Max Brew Works
breweries.details: We are a local minded farm brewery dedicated to and specializing in richly crafted handmade ales and lagers. Because we believe in the locavore practice and coupled with time honored traditions, practices and green processes you will appreciate each our craft brews. Time is what goes into making every Mean Max Brew Works a delicious take on our variety of offerings. We handcraft our beers in small, three barrel batches under the direct personal attention of our Brewmaster. Our unfiltered ales and lagers are fermented naturally without additives making each consistent and distinctive whether it's packed in growlers, bottles or draft kegs. Visit our Tap Room which features a fine selection of brews. Try our Glen Street Lager or the Tahawus IPA, Artist Rock, Roostercomb and Nine Pin Cider. We also serve cocktails, spirits, wine and soft drinks. Planning to have a meal Mean Max invites you to bring in food from a nearby restaurant to enjoy with your favorite brew. Ask us about our Beer Review Board.

breweries.name: Middle Ages Brewing Company
breweries.details: Middle Ages Brewing Company is the longest running brewery in Syracuse NY. They produce many local favorites like Syracuse Pale Ale, Impaled Ale, Wailing Wench, Swallow Wit, and Dinosaur BBQ's House Beer - Ape Hanger Ale. They also do plenty of experimental beers including a Single Batch IPA series and barrel aged beers.

breweries.name: Mill House Brewing Company
breweries.details: Winning numerous awards for both their beer and food, Mill House Brewing transforms an old Poughkeepsie mill house into a casual, hip and lively brew pub. You’ll always find staples such as Köld One, Kilt Spinner Ale, or Velvet Panda Stout on tap, plus numerous others their pro brewers have developed. Their beer list is long, and delicious. By using farm fresh ingredients, the brew pub menu is designed to complement the beers. Dig into gourmet pizzas, BBQ platters, Charcuterie boards, burgers or full seafood or meat entrees -- you’ll experience something delicious for every taste and appetite.

breweries.name: Montauk Brewing Company
breweries.details: Pouring craft beers since 2012, Montauk Brewing Company brings craftsmanship and bold flavor to Eastern Long Island. With the taproom open year round, their IPAs, ales and sessions are a perfect Montauk beverage for the summer heat or the winter beach.

breweries.name: Mortalis Brewing Company
breweries.details: A wide range of delicious and unconventional beers using the finest ingredients and providing patrons with a relaxed and unpretentious tasting room experience where everyone can find a beer they will enjoy. In addition to beer, they offer several tasty (and like their beer, unconventional) food items, red and white wines, cider, and non-alcoholic beverages, which are sourced locally whenever possible.

breweries.name: Naked Dove Brewing Company
breweries.details: The perfect place to learn about beer, Naked Dove offers a tour of its microbrewery, as well as a tasting room and gift shop to explore beers made right in the Finger Lakes! Beer styles include an amber ale, IPA, porter, black raspberry ale and other seasonal specialties.

breweries.name: New York Beer Project
breweries.details: Brewery with attached gastropub, tap room, beer garden, outdoor deck by the water and private event space overlooking the brewery.

breweries.name: Newburgh Brewing Company
breweries.details: Craft production brewery located inside a 160-year old brick warehouse, right off the Hudson River in Newburgh. Newburgh Brewing opened in 2012 and brews 6 year-round styles in addition to a large selection of specialty and one-time offerings. A beautiful taproom at the brewery features long communal tables, games, and breathtaking views of the Hudson River Valley.

breweries.name: No BS Brew Company
breweries.details: No BS Brew Company is nestled near the north end of Conesus Lake. No BS Brew Company features 15 taps that rotate over 100 of their own recipes. Head Brewer and co-owner Benjamin Noragong utilizes his SUNY Geneseo Bio-Chem degree to make the magic on location in their 3bbl brew house. Enjoy a beer, mixed drink, local wine and local cider - something special for every palette. Also a member of the Livingston Libation Loop.

breweries.name: Oval Craft Brewing
breweries.details: Oval Craft Brewing is a historic brewery located on the former Air Force Base. It's a small microbrewery producing 10 bbl batches of fine craft beer. OCB beer is available in select restaurants and bars in the Plattsburgh area. Oval Craft also has a tasting room at the brewery where patrons can enjoy a pint, flight or take a growler home.

breweries.name: Oyster Bay Brewing Company
breweries.details: Oyster Bay Brewing Company is in the business of making great beers locally on Long Island. Since 2012, our brewery has been committed to producing unconventional ales and lagers that defy styles, categories and your imagination. Our handcrafted brews utilize only the best ingredients with a sensational rich taste. We take special care to ensure every batch is the best we can brew.

breweries.name: Paradox Brewery
breweries.details: Located in North Hudson NY, Paradox Brewery offers a scenic experience overlooking the Adirondack Mountains for customers to enjoy their delicious craft beer. This 25,000 square feet facility can produce up to 50,000 barrels of beer per year and offers a safe and enjoyable drinking experience with its outdoor tasting room and pavilion. Frequently hosting a variety of food trucks and always serving hot IPA pretzels, you will be able to enjoy food while choosing from a variety of the core beers or specialty one-off beers. Both dog and kid friendly, Paradox Brewery offers a great time to enjoy pure Adirondack craft beer.

breweries.name: Pearl Street Grill & Brewery
breweries.details: A fun, historic brewpub, featuring signature beers and award-winning entrees. A favorite spot for watching sports games or listening to live music, Pearl Street offers multiple levels of indoor bars and outdoor patios. A great place to gather before events at KeyBank Center.

breweries.name: Plattsburgh Brewing Company
breweries.details: Home of the authentic War of 1812 Beer, Plucky Rooster Ale, Plattsburgh Brewing Company offers an incredibly diverse line of handcrafted beers. Featured by a wine preservation system, 24 bottles of temperature-controlled, perfectly-preserved wine are always ready to be enjoyed!

breweries.name: Port Jeff Brewing Company
breweries.details: Port Jeff Brewing Company is located at 22 Mill Creek Road, within the Chandler Square walking mall. The brewery features a 7 barrel system which is capable of producing 217 gallons (about 86 cases) per brew. Beers are packaged in keg, cans, 22 ounce and special release bottle formats for distribution throughout Long Island, New York City, and West Chester County bars, restaurants, and other retail beer outlets. Directly adjacent to the production facility is our retail store boasting 12 taps and one beer cask engine atop a handcrafted wooden boat bar. Beer can be taken home in keg, growler, cans and special release bottles (when available.) Beer can also be consumed onsite in tasting flights, pints, or single can servings. Open 12 - 8PM (Every Day of the year except Christmas)

breweries.name: Pressure Drop Brewing
breweries.details: Pressure Drop Brewing, located in The Barrel Factory, is a new Western New York brewery. They offer a wide variety of beer, brewed in Buffalo, NY, with a West coast inspiration! Enjoy their beer in the Lakeward Spirits Tasting Room at The Barrel Factory in Buffalo's legendary Old First Ward!

breweries.name: Prison City Pub & Brewery
breweries.details: Prison City Pub & Brewery is a brewpub and a restaurant serving pub food, as well as craft beer made on premise that compliments their menu. Located in downtown Auburn NY, Prison City is a gathering place for people who enjoy locally made beer and food. Prison City Pub & Brewery sells hand-crafted beers brewed on premise by their Brewmaster and pair it with elevated pub food with a focus on farm-to-table cuisine. They also offer an extensive beer, wine, and cocktail list in addition to their house made beers. Come in and enjoy a laid back, high quality, industrial/rustic establishment where everything is being made before your eyes

breweries.name: Racing City Brewing Co
breweries.details: From a city where winning is everything and echoes of past glories can still be heard from the backstretch to Broadway, comes a family-owned brewery and winery that is inspired by it all. Racing City Brewing Co. with Oliva Winery is about more than just making good beer and wine. We're serving up a cold companion during a long afternoon of handicapping or a cozy confidante during an epic night out on the town. Crafted with the smooth sophistication of the Opera and the amplified aggression of Rock & Roll at our famous Ampitheatre, Racing City Brewng Co. with Oliva Winery is a product of its environment. We are Racing City.

breweries.name: Railhead Brewing Company
breweries.details: A railhead is the beginning or the end of the line. For craft brewer Dave Woolever and his partner, Michael McCumiskey, the RailHead Brewing Company is the beginning of a great new adventure. Both young men grew up in Hornell, raised on stories about the railroad – Hornell had once been the primary maintenance facility for the entire Erie line – and about Hornell Brewing Company which had thrived, in one form or another, for over 55 years. Stop by for a tasting and discover for yourself why RailHead has been so popular with locals and tourists alike since it first opened its doors. Try a delicious brick-oven pizza – we might suggest the Margherita or Chicken & Arugula; sample tasty brews like the Saison, American Wheat, German-style Altbier, and the popular pub-style Oatmeal Stout; and enjoy the warm, friendly atmosphere of a brew pub with a hometown feel.

breweries.name: Raquette River Brewing
breweries.details: Raquette River Brewing is small batch, hand crafted with a touch of high tech. Producing high quality Adirondack Ales in Tupper Lake, NY.

breweries.name: Red Hawk Brewing
breweries.details: Red Hawk Brewing is a Farm Brewery that is located on an 18 Acre Farm in the Town of Onondaga. The building is designed with an Old World atmosphere. Outdoor seating is available from Spring through Fall. With a woodland background, rolling fields and amazing sunsets, Red Hawk Brewing is in relaxing country setting that can be enjoyed by all.

breweries.name: Red Shed Brewery
breweries.details: Red Shed Brewery Cooperstown Taproom is a craft farm brewery dedicated to making fresh, handcrafted ales using local NY hops and grains.  As a NY state farm brewer, Red Shed beers feature the best of locally grown hops and ingredients, and the recipes we develop are designed to bring out the best of the region in each beer we brew.  Our taproom on Cty Hwy 33 features 10-15 taps of Red Shed ales, and NY ciders & wines.Red Shed is proud to feature weekly trivia and live music as well as other events during the season.  Follow us on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook or visit Redshedbrewing.com for more details and a list of upcoming events or to view our beer and food menus.

breweries.name: Rip Van Winkle Brewery
breweries.details: Proudly brewing the finest craft beers, with Catskill Mountain spring water from the land of Rip Van Winkle. Beers are handcrafted by an award winning Brew master.

breweries.name: Resurgence Brewing Company
breweries.details: Resurgence Brewing Company is a brewery & beer garden located on the West Side of Buffalo. Their goal is to bring a memorable “beer experience” to the drinkers of the greater Buffalo region, whether at home, in a favorite bar, or at the brewery.

breweries.name: Rising Storm Brewing Company
breweries.details: Rising Storm Brewing Company is a small-scale microbrewery about a half hour south of Rochester. Located on 12.5 acres. They typically have ten to 12 beers on tap from their 30 recipes. Their mission at Rising Storm Brewing Co.™ is simple — make exceptional beer, deliver the most memorable craft beer experience, and have fun doing it. Find them on the Livingston Libation Loop.

breweries.name: Roc Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Roc Brewing Co., LLC in 2011 was one of the first breweries to hit the growing Rochester brewing scene. Come check out the taproom and production facility in the heart of downtown. Cheers to all of our friends and supporter, we look forward to serving everyone a pint or two and a memorable experience. RBC features 7 beer taps, rotating on a regular basis. So stop in often to see what’s “on-tap”. We serve NYS cider, and a selection of wine and soft drinks. There is a limited menu for a quick bite. Whether you’re on a NY craft beer bus tour, craft beer enthusiast traveling through Rochester or one of the many craft beer drinkers in Upstate, we would be delighted to host you in the taproom at 56 S. Union Street.

breweries.name: Roscoe Beer Company
breweries.details: Stop in and try a variety of beers brewed right in Roscoe, NY. We'll gladly fill your growler or have one here available for purchase. Always on tap is our flagship brew, Trout Town American Amber Ale. Don't forget to check out the gift shop, proudly offering USA made apparel and gifts. We look forward to seeing you and remember, stay responsibly thirsty!

breweries.name: Rusty Nickel Brewing Company
breweries.details: Rusty Nickel Brewing Company is brewed just a little different. There's beer, cider, wine and spirits as well as non-alcoholic craft soda, apparel, dog treats, glassware, finger foods, and a full menu from the Ebenezer Ale House. Featuring a beautiful beer garden, rustic tasting room and one-of-a-kind craft beers.

breweries.name: Sackets Harbor Brewing Co.
breweries.details: The Sackets Harbor Brewing Company operates one of New York State's oldest continuing microbreweries. Located in historic Sackets Harbor, and situated on the shore of Lake Ontario, the dining room and outside deck boast expansive views of the lake and sunsets. The five star gastropub and restaurant offers upscale pub fare and fine dining, paired with a rotating selection of original craft beers brewed on-site. The brewery produces over 35 distinct beers year round, with around 10 on tap. Additionally, the Pub recently installed a beer engine for cask conditioned ales, which are typically served Thursday through the weekend.

breweries.name: Sato Brewpub
breweries.details: Sato Brewpub is unique in that they are using Japanese ingredients like yuzu, togarashi, and soba buckwheat from our kitchen in combination with local ingredients like hops grown in Niagara county to compliment our Japanese Izakaya dishes. Izakaya are casual Japanese gastropubs meant to be a place of socializing over small-plates and beer and sake.

breweries.name: Scale House Brewery
breweries.details: Located in Hector, NY, we’ve got something for just about everyone. Whether you’re looking for a quality Craft Beer or a one in a million Gourmet Pizza, or even if you’re just looking for a relaxing spot with your friends with an amazing view, we’ve got you covered.

breweries.name: Seneca St. Brewery
breweries.details: The Menikheim Family opened Seneca St Brew Pub in April 2016 in the old First Baptist Church of Manlius built in 1829. From brewing to managing the daily activities at the pub, the Menikheim family works together to offer you the best atmosphere and beer in Manlius. As a Farm Brewery, they are committed to sourcing the ingredients in beers from NY State Farmers. They also grow a variety of their own hops on a two-acre farm on Rt 173 in Manlius, NY. Located in the basement of the old church, the cozy brewpub is an inviting space to relax with friends while you enjoy craft beers. Seneca St Brew Pub is the perfect place to host your event. The event room can be rented out for any type of party, event, or business meeting. The patio is a great place to relax and enjoy some great tasting beers and specialty snacks. On the main level of our building is Seneca St Bottle Shop where they sell all NYS Beer, Cider, Wine and Distilled Spirits for consumption on and off property.

breweries.name: Shep's Brewing Company
breweries.details: Shep's Brewing Company is a family-operated small-craft nano-brewery with a tasting room offering 5-6 beers on tap and growlers to go. They produce many classic styles including Amber Ale, Pumpkin Beer, Irish Red, IPA, Maerzen (Oktoberfest), and Pilsner.

breweries.name: Skaneateles Brewery
breweries.details: Tap room and brewhouse located right outside of the Village of Skaneateles. Producing small-batch products, visitors will be able to taste and purchase the brews. In 2017, two good friends tossed around the idea of opening a brewery in this old mill . It had history and charm…. and lots of challenges for sure. Now 2 1/2 years later we bring you Skaneateles Brewery! Just like 100 yrs ago, brewing with the best water in all The Fingerlakes, we harness the water and pay tribute to Skaneateles Creek’s historic past. Come visit our State-of-the-art taproom and brewhouse: offering you a warm and inviting gathering place to relax with friends- old and new. Friendly dogs welcome!

breweries.name: Slate Town Brewing Company
breweries.details: We are a New York State Farm Brewery and Taproom located on Main Street in Granville, NY. We are dedicated to brewing exceptional beer using local ingredients, all set in a cool industrial building. We are open Wed - Sunday with food trucks on weekends until our kitchen is on line. We currently have 8 beers on tap with more being released soon, we also have hard cider and wine. We also fill Crowlers (32 ounce cans) at the tapwall, as well as pints and flights of beer. Come visit us, sip some brews, check out the brewery room, play a game of pool or indoor corn hole, and raise a glass with new friends. Cheers!

breweries.name: Spider Bite Beer Co.
breweries.details: Spider Bite Beer Company was conceived back in 2008 by founders and friends Larry Goldstein and Anthony LiCausi after a summer of too many bug bites. During the past year Spider Bite has released a number of beers from the Pale Ale family, stouts, saisons and a very well received Wee Heavy. In their first year of business, Robert’s Spider Wee Heavy, coupled with their Eight Legged RyePA and Boris the Spider Russian Imperial Stout, earned them the 2012 FX Matt Memorial Cup for “Best Craft Brewery” in NY State. Come try a variety of craft Spider Bite beers straight from the source. Our draft list from BeerMenus will be added to the website soon so you know what we are pouring!

breweries.name: Steuben Brewing Company
breweries.details: Steuben Brewing Company offers more than a Brew with a View, but the view really is inspiring and visitors are encouraged to enjoy the beautiful scenery with their beers on the covered outdoor patio. Whether you're out to sample a few beers by yourself or you've got your whole posse with you, take some time to savor the excellent brews Chad and his family are creating, like the popular Pale Ale, Hopyard IPA, or Hometown Brown. With eight beers on tap, including three rotating experimental beers, you're sure to find a brew you can call yours. Steuben Brewing Company is one of several New York State Farm breweries in Corning and the Southern Finger Lakes. That means they use local ingredients. Chad is already working on creating his own field of hops and other ingredients to be grown right there on the premises. In addition to producing fine beers, he also wants the brewery to be an educational resource on agritourism.

breweries.name: Suarez Family Brewery
breweries.details: This mom and pop production brewery specializes in ales of mixed fermentation lagers and other crispy little beers. Brewer owned and operated. The best way to find them is to enter Suarez Family Brewery into Google Maps. All parking is at the rear of the brick brewery building. Tasting Room is open Wed 4-7pm and Fri and Sat 12-7pm.

breweries.name: Subversive Malting & Brewery
breweries.details: Subversive Malting + Brewing is a true farmhouse brewery crafting beers from 100% locally sourced ingredients at the foot of the Catskill Mountains. Driven by a passion for native ingredients and inspired by the bounty that surrounds them in New York State, they aim to capture a sense of place in each of their beers. They opened their doors in December 2018 as a nano-sized operation producing out of a small barn in Livingston, NY. Within a year of opening, they expanded production operations and moved them into an old mechanic’s garage in the Village of Catskill, NY, with an onsite taproom which opened in early 2020. The beers are simple and expressive and appeal to a wide variety of palates.

breweries.name: Summerhill Brewing
breweries.details: We are a family owned Farm Brewery in scenic southern Cayuga County. Our brewery started humbly in our garage in 2016 and grew to the point of needing to expand. In May of 2019 we opened an expanded production facility and new tasting room. In the fall of 2020 our kitchen opened, offering artisan pizza and soft pretzels; tacos on Thursday and Sunday Brunch. We take pride in brewing with local ingredients and offering a variety of hand crafted small batch ales. In addition to a beer menu we also offer a nice selection of local wines and hard ciders and non-alcoholic options. Check out our website and social media pages for current information on hours, menus, beer releases and events.

breweries.name: Syracuse Suds Factory
breweries.details: The Syracuse Suds Factory offers an unique dining and drinking experience. Established in 1991, the Syracuse Suds Factory brought locally brewed beer back to the City of Syracuse. The Syracuse Suds Factory's restaurant and micro-brewery have been a favorite to those who truly enjoy great food and spirits. Capacity for groups: up to 180 people.

breweries.name: The Cape Vincent Brewing Company
breweries.details: The Cape Vincent Brewing Company is a New York State farm brewery located centrally in the village of Cape Vincent. We specialize in handcrafted, traditional beers and provide a quaint, friendly atmosphere for our patrons. New York state wine and soda is also available.

breweries.name: Thin Man Brewery
breweries.details: Thin Man is the result of many people putting their heads together to make something new and different. With upscale food and experimental brews, Thin Man is the Elmwood Village's first brewery.

breweries.name: TripEnd Brewing
breweries.details: TripEnd Brewing is a small, family-run farm brewery nestled on a hillside in Troupsburg with scenic views of the valley. After renovating an old Amish Barn into a 1,200 square-foot tasting room, Mark Lemay and his wife, Jessica Bart, offer tastings, pints, and growlers of their own tasty brews as well as those from other local breweries and cideries. Little did Jessica realize the home-brew kit she bought Mark for his birthday years ago when they lived in Maryland would turn into such a passion project they’re bringing to life back in his hometown. TripEnd’s goal is to craft delicious brews that can be enjoyed with friends. Adventure Pairing There are a number of awesome outdoor adventures just waiting to be discovered in proximity to each of our beverage producers. Please find suggested adventure pairings and have fun crafting your adventure.Pinnacle State Park, Finger Lakes Trail.

breweries.name: Upstate Brewing Company
breweries.details: Upstate Brewing is an award-winning, unconventional craft brewery in Elmira. It was founded on the mission of producing locally brewed beer hat appeals to the tastes of a broader audience. You'll find rotating food trucks on site throughout the summer months, and a plethora of draft beer on site, including both regular and seasonal. Fun, robust atmosphere!

breweries.name: Wagner Vineyards Winery, Brewery & Ginny Lee Cafe
breweries.details: he family and staff at Wagner Vineyards, Wagner Valley Brewing Co., and the Ginny Lee Café ABOUT WAGNER VINEYARDS Wagner Vineyards Estate Winery is one of the oldest and most recognized wineries in the Finger Lakes Region. Family owned and operated, the fourth and fifth generation Wagners are in the vineyards and in the cellar to bring you the best quality Finger Lakes wine. Centrally located on the eastern shore of Seneca Lake, Wagner Vineyards has been one of the region’s most popular wine tasting destinations since opening in 1979. Over 30 award winning wines ranging from bone dry to dessert wine sweet. Whether you prefer red wine, white wine, light and sweet wines made from grapes native to the Finger Lakes region or dry European, or vinifera, style wines you will be sure to find a wine for you. Visit our winery for a wine tasting and while you’re there enjoy lunch at the Ginny Lee Cafe and beer tasting from our craft brewery! Wagner Valley Brewing Company typically has 9-12 craft beers available in the brewery with styles ranging from light to dark, bitter to sweet. The Ginny Lee Cafe offers a wide selection of delicious food with original recipes that are made to be paired with your favorite Wagner wine or beer. Cafe hours change seasonally.

breweries.name: West Shore Brewing Company
breweries.details: West Shore Brewing is named after the railroad which brought the owner's great-grandfather to the area almost one-hundred years ago. At West Shore Brewing they want to earn your business and patronage, one beer at a time. Using influences from not only Buffalo, but the region as a whole, they want to operate the business a little differently and hope you will enjoy the ride. Please check the website for days and hours of operation.

breweries.name: Westhampton Beach Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Westhampton Beach Brewing Company newly opened in Westhampton Beach has a beautiful indoor/ outdoor tasting room where you can sip a pint, observe our in-house brewing operations and live our motto Every Day's a Beach Day!

breweries.name: Rooster Fish Brewing
breweries.details: The downtown restaurant that has become the standard. Local and organic as much as possible, healthy preparations. Featuring Rooster Fish Beers.

breweries.name: Willow Rock Brewing Company
breweries.details: Willow Rock Brewing Company, focuses on American style craft beers, but usually, has other styles available in the tap room in the form of seasonals and limited edition releases. The brewery is located off of Ainsley Dr. on the south side of Syracuse just south of the Comstock Neighborhood, and the Syracuse University campus.

breweries.name: Wood Boat Brewery
breweries.details: Craft Brewery that also sells brick oven pizza. When the weather is warm, there is nothing better than sipping some brew, enjoying some grub and the views of the magnificent St. Lawrence River with amazing sunsets on the outdoor deck. In the cooler months, enjoy the fun, friendly indoor pub-style restaurant and lounge.

breweries.name: Woodcock Bros Brewing Co.
breweries.details: Woodcock Bros Brewing Co is a micro-brewery and restaurant located in historic Wilson, NY. It is surrounded by apple, cherry, and grape orchards and smack dab in the middle of the Niagara Wine Trail, USA. From pizza to prime rib, everything on the menu is wood-fired in custom brick ovens, crafted from scratch, and cooked with love. Open year-round.

breweries.name: Woodland Farm Brewery
breweries.details: Woodland Farm Brewery just outside of Utica taps into all of the above, embracing experimentation with its primarily New York State grown beers. Co-founders Keith Redhead and Nick Natishak wanted to combine their passion for beer with an appreciation of Central New York’s brewing history. They established Woodland and captured the essence of Brew Central, America’s Craft Brew Destination. As a brewer, Redhead strives to create new vibrant and tasty beers regularly! If you love one of their beers when you stop in and drink up! It might not be back again! Barrel aged beers and cask ales are two of the main focuses at Woodland. With two beer engines, there are always two cask offerings at any time! Their casks rotate regularly and offer variations and concoctions of whats on tap; each with a little twist. Some times with more hops in the cask, maybe even local coffee or even cocoa. Ain't nothing gonna stop them from throwing in some hot peppers, peanut butter, or fruit from time to time, too!

breweries.name: WT Brews
breweries.details: WT Brews is a microbrewery located in Baldwinsville, NY. As a New York State Farm Brewery they put their focus on local ingredients to hand craft all of their beers, including growing their own hops at their farm, WT Acres. WT Brews holds pride in brewing high quality, hand crafted beer that supports their local agriculture and community while showcasing the best of New York.
